text: Bottle at Pegs Cycle BA Day thanks to Kevin. Pours a hazy ruby with small pinkish white head that lasts. The aroma is strong cherry skin, funk, oak. Thin body, sweet cherry, oak, funk, light acidity, nice tartness, really enjoyed this.
Bottle. Big tip of the cap to Seth for sharing this one. Pinkish pour with a white head. Sour fruit aromas. Taste follows suit. Subtle but really tasty. Good body and mouthfeel.

750 mL bottle. Looks like apple juice with a bit of redness. Smell has a nice cherry aroma. Lots of vanilla. Sweet cherry. Mild acidity. Taste is a very nice cherry. Lightly sweet. Some sweetness. Finish has a strong sour bite, but its never too strong. Medium body. Delicious, even with the intense finish.
Finally I get to try this one! Pours a deep orange with a white head. Really nice sourness, some cherry, cranberry, plain yogurt, light funk. Damn right!

Bottle at Campground Brewdown 2014. Pours a hazy pink with a thin white head. Big cheesy funk, wood and cherries on the nose. Medium bodied, spicy cherry, big funk and bright acid. Funky, bright and tangy. Tart with long cherries and a bit of acid.
Orange-pink pour, white head. Nose is berries, herbal tea. Taste is huge berries - raspberries, strawberries, tart, herbal.

This one poured a pinkish red with a pink head. Aroma was of berries, cherry pits, watermelon, wet grass and hay, light Brett and rusticity. Flavor was birght cherry and Berry character, medium sourness, very well balance between barn, fruit, acidity and bretty. Awesome stuff.
UPDATED: AUG 3, 2014 Bottle. Pours pinkish grapefruit. White head. Nose/taste of oak, cherry, tart acid and earthy cherry. Medium body.
Bottle. Pink grapefruit pour with white head. Light fruit, tart tones, light cherry aromas. Cherry, tart fruit and light sweet tones.

UPDATED: JUL 30, 2014 Bottle shared thanks to beerman6686. Cloudy pinkish orange pour with a white head. Aroma is slightly floral, some cherry, sourness. The taste is slightly tart but cleans up after itself nicely. Effervescent mouthfeel. One of my favorites, better than the Grrrz.
Bottle shared thanks to arts house. Poured light hazy peach with thing head. Aroma quite sour honey. Light carb med bod. Sweet sour farm taste.

UPDATED: JUL 16, 2014 Bottle: 38/360. Thanks, Nolan. The color of a ruby red grapefruit, deep & nearly opaque, topped with a slightly lavender tinted foam that fizzles to a collar. Aroma is sour right up front. Ripe, sour cherries dipped in lactic acid. Acidity in the form of cherry skin & lemon with a softer, juicy cherry flesh sweetness bringing up the rear. Very lovely cherry flavor, juicy & pure with a souring quality that instantly puckers the lips. Cherry fresh, lemon, mild acidity, & heaps of sour lacto. A little bit of that almost cinnamon-y spice that I get from certain cherry beers. Dry finish, kiss of woodiness & drying cherry flavor. Would have liked some more funk, but nevertheless: a simply delicious fruited American wild ale.

Bottle from a recent Tampa crew tasting. Pours a nice pink color with a white head. Nose is berry, funk, oak, vinous fruit, and cherries, and lacto. Flavor is similar with tartness, berrries, funk, oak, cherries, and lacto. Some berries on the finish.

Pinkish amber-red with a thin off-white head and spotty lacing. Sour cherries, nice minerality, must, and lactic characteristics. Medium bodied, lively acidity with appropriate carbonation. Nice tart finish. A success.

750 ml. corked and caged bottle. It pours a very bright pink color with a lot of effervescence. The fizzy white head dissipates rather quickly. The aroma has some sharp mineral acidity with a TON of old cheese and a little strawberry and cherries. The flavor is light and airy with some rich cherry and cheesy funk. Nice tartness that stops short of being sour. Pretty light on the palate for the ABV with a nice bretty, cherry finish. Good stuff.

Huge thanks to Colin for sharing this bottle a few weeks ago. Nose is strong, ripe cherry with a focus on the pulp rather than skin or pit. Lively lactic acidity with no acetic. Bright lemon behind the cherry. Really quite nice and very, very drinkable. Could have used a bit more funk, but otherwise no real complaints.
Pours a hazy orange with a thin white head. Aroma of oranges, sour fruit, lacto and Brett. Funky and sour, sweet tropical fruit and Brett. Solid sour.

Pour is clear cherry red with a right white head. Nose is woody and dusty with a nice fleshy cherry note and a bit of lacto. Taste is fairly sour, meaty body with balanced carb. Cherries are very fleshy and ripe, more lacto. Dusty flavors are more subdued, cherries are rather bright and sourness is strong but pleasant.

Thanks Chris 

Bottle poured a pinkish red color. Smell of lambic yeast, funk and yeast. Flavir was a.mixture of cherry and watermelon which the latter was weird... decent kriek esc, but fell short of the mark
750ml bottle. Nice label. Poured a ruby/pinkish color with a pinkish tinged head. Cherries, vanilla, some lighter funkiness, and berries. Very nice.

hazy amber red, thin white film, light effervescence. Light celery and heavy egg brett, tons of dark cherry, arsenic pith. Flavor is similar, light dough and green vines early before woody cherry emerges mid and a pith arsenic bitterness in the end, eggy brett all throughout. Carbonation needs thinning.

Hazed Indian red with thin white head. Nose is meaty cherries, some tight brett yeast. Mouth is very meaty sour cherries, rich, tight Brett, really nice. Sour cherry flavor is very full and round, only comparison is a fresh Lou Pepe Kriek. Very nice beer.
Bottle shared during the Jackie-Os Anniversary bottle share. Pours a copper color with a white head of foam. The aroma has lots of tart cherry influence. Sour and fruity taste. Medium bodied.

Bottle 750ml.
Pours nice salmon with low white head. Minimal lacing. Aroma is of cherries, acid, berries. Taste is of cherries, watermelon, fruits, acidity, slight sugar. Palate: Light-medium body. Very nice balance. Overall: Pretty good. Not too acidic, which is good.

Pours a dark pink with a medium pinkish head that leaves some lacing. Aroma is of real cherries and acid. Taste is fruity and sour with the same real (tart) cherries that were perceived in the aroma.The acidity is really refreshing. Light bodied, medium-high carbonation. Really good and refeshing, I could drink a lot of this!

Bottle (750 ml). Thanks to Michael for this one. Beautiful clear salmon/copper with as small persistent off-white/pinkish head. There is a load of cherries (sweet & sour) in the aroma along a nice acidic touch, cheesy presence, vanilla and oak. Taste is of cherries (a ton), light sweetness, nice acidic touch that make the beer intensely drinkable, oak, vanilla and cheesy notes. Medium body. Moderate carbonation. Slightly dry finish. Great balance between sweet and sour. Super drinkable. Complex. Lambic-like. Amazing!

bottle gracefully shared by mistertom10101, many thanks brah. pours hazy almost cloudy bright pink with a small yet lasting pinkish cap, nice lacing. sweet and tart cherries, cheese and lactic along with restrained acetic notes, stones, cinnamon, hint of vanilla - could be from wood tho, nice balance of sweetness/acidity, powdery candies. lively and soft carbonation, light body, lightly sweet, tart and fruity-grassy finish. very nice mouthfeel. very good fruit lambic.

Bottle courtesy of Frank shared with Frank and Vinny. Pours a beautiful, bright hazy ruby red body with light fine, white lacing. Aroma is cherries and sour fruit. Light funk. Very nice. Mouthfeel is carbonated and light. Super drinkable with not too much acidity. Notes of cherry, limes, vanilla, lightly mineral, basement funk, strawberries, cinnamon crust and sour fruit.

Bottle with Barry, and Frank shared by Frank compliments of Nate. Pours hazy glowing pinkish red with small white head, and sporadic lacing. Notes of cherry funk, vtg wood, vanilla, cherry slurpee, geuze, mineral water, oak, cheese, enigma, rose gambrinus, marischino and montmorency cherries, and other kriek flavor. Medium bodied with lots of tart earthiness. One of the best sours I have tried thats come out of america. I later found out this was made with vanilla beans and cherry...makes sense. Ridiculously good.
